result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Michael Hayden

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

10:06 AM/10:11AM Defendant Joshua Michael Hayden appeared by audio means.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Joshua Michael Hayden.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond Continued.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and within time limits. Defendant address: 2566 Riverside Dr. Beloit, WI.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Michael Hayden appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Joshua Michael Hayden. Conflict for Public Defenders Office. Court finds good cause for extending time limits. Matter continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Michael Hayden appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond with conditions: Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact directly or indirectly with victim D.L.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Preliminary Hearing scheduled August 12, 2022 at 9:15 AM.
